channel.title: djconnor mixes
channel.description:
There are more than a hundred mixes available for your personal consumption. Search songs or artists featured in archived mixes.Please support a DJ by purchasing featured tracks you enjoyed listening to from our sponsors.
(1) Press the play button and listen to a live stream on your left; (2) Right-click the download link and save file on your desktop; (3) Subscribe through iTunes; or (4) Subscribe to my RSS feed through some other RSS Reader. If you have no idea what I'm talking about, (5) read what RSS means.
I hope you find something you enjoy. Thanks for listening,

item.title: Electro | Quadraphonic
item.description: I'm kicking this mix off with probably my favorite Bjork b-side ever. Don't get me wrong- Bachelorette was a fantastic song long before RZA got his hands on it. It just shouldn't be a surprise when his melodic wu-beats fill out the epic arrangement. Upon final review, this mix has a rather triphoppy feel to it. Hmm. That wasn't the intention. Ah, well. I go where the music takes me. Anyhow, I present Quadraphonic for your listening pleasure. bjork | bachelorette (rza remix) biggie | niggas bleed gorillaz | new genius gangstarr | all 4 the ca$h johnnie taylor | i got to love somebody's baby terranova | chase the blues (somecracker remix) asian dub foundation | PKNB peanut butter wolf | necromancing cam'ron | down and out (instrumental) koop | waltz for koop (DJ patife remix) mos def | the panties pato banton & mad professor | king step
item.dc:creator: djconnor
item.itunes:summary:
I'm kicking this mix off with probably my favorite Bjork b-side ever. Don't get me wrong- Bachelorette was a fantastic song long before RZA got his hands on it. It just shouldn't be a surprise when his melodic wu-beats fill out the epic arrangement.
Upon final review, this mix has a rather triphoppy feel to it. Hmm. That wasn't the intention. Ah, well. I go where the music takes me.
Anyhow, I present Quadraphonic for your listening pleasure.

item.description: We had some requests- Slimdog wanted some Procussions. I've got The Storm on this mix. Great tip, man. Keep 'em coming. (Deux Process will be on the next mix.) My brother Gary was feeling some RATM- something off Evil Empire. Here's Down Rodeo. Christina didn't out right ask for the Bubba Sparxxx track (are three x's really necessary, Bubba?), but I know she's digging it. And the final request... that came from me. What can I say? JT is my guilty pleasure. [Intro]: [ Count Bubba | Gordon Goodwin's Big Phat Band / Hunter S Thompson | Excerpt from Lecture at Boulder University ] The Procussions | The Storm The Pharcyde | Knew U People Under The Stairs | Tuxedo Rap Basic Vocab | Vibin Jurassic 5 | Canto De Ossanha Naughty by Nature | Uptown Anthem Rage Against the Machine | Down Rodeo Bubba Sparxxx & Ying Yang Twins | Ms New Booty Justin Timberlake | SexyBack

item.title: HipHop | Bringing it Back
item.description: Bringing it Back, in all of two acts. First, I'm taking it oldskool, with some OG good times. They moved the parties and got shit going. Let's take a ride on the oldskool way back train. With the second act, I make the leap to some breakbeat, because well, that's just how I roll. Be on the look out for dabs of some drum n bass and house. Who knows. _act_i_oldskool_hiphop_ Treacherous Three | Feel the Heartbeat Nairobi & the Awesome Foursome | * Spoonie Gee | The Godfather Biz Markie | The Gator (Dance) DJ Kool | Let Me Clear My Throat (Old School) The Pharcyde | Oh Shit The Beastie Boys | Shake Your Rump _act_ii_breakbeat_ Simply Jeff | Drop Tha Bomb Mr Oizo vs Oxide & Neutrino | Flat Eric Gets Shot DJ Icey | Slake Planet Funk | Who Said (Stuck in the UK)

item.title: HipHop | The Go-Go Scenario
item.description: I realized how wrong it is that I have two regional mixes representing Bay Area's hyphy movement- 'hot.block (03.02.06) and Git Stupid Dumb (10.16.06)- before I recognize DC's own local Go-Go scene. How wrong I am! As you work your way through this mix you'll be moving back in time; I kick it off with some classic DJ Kool and conclude with Chuck Brown, the acclaimed Godfather of Go-Go. My intention is for this mix to stand on its own, but to also serve as the first half of my funk revival series. Look for the second chapter next time up. Enjoy. DJ Kool | Put That Hump (In Your Back) [Sampled]: Wesley, Fred & JBs | If You Don't Get It The First Time, Back Up and Try It Again, Party [Sampled]: Wu-Tang Clan | C.R.E.A.M. Little Benny and the Masters | Cat in the Hat [Sampled]: The Beastie Boys | Hey Ladies Chuck Brown | Take the Go-Go Train Northeast Groovers | The Water Backyard Band & Rare Essence | Sexy Girl Chuck Brown | Get Your Hands Up / Playing Your Game, Baby Rare Essence | Overnight Scenario Trouble Funk | Drop The Bomb Junkyard Band | Sardines Chuck Brown | We the People [Sampled]: The Beastie Boys | Hey Ladies

item.title: electro | Bjork: Colossal
item.description: Oddly enough, I rarely go to concerts, primarily because I've been disappointed so often and at great cost. However, I make exceptions every once in awhile. On September 24th, we ventured up to Manhattan for Bjork's Madison Square Garden concert. She was incredible, as was Mark Bell. This mix is divided into two sections. Act I is if I had any input on the evening's set list. Act II is a close approximation to Bjork's playlist. However, she deviated from album arrangements (as always), so don't expect some black market stream from the show. In any case, please do enjoy. If you are familiar with Bjork, I hope you rejoice in this mix, as I'm sure Christina, Mariana, and Sean will. If you're not very familiar with her music, take a trip down this musical path, with an open mind and willing ears. I assure you it is all worthwhile. Act I: If I Had My Way In the Musicals Isobel (portishead Remix) Vertebrae By Vertebrae Pluto Act II: The Concert Hunter Pagan Poetry I See Who You Are Unravel Pleasure Is All Mine The Dull Flame Of Desire Joga Desired Constellation Army Of Me Innocence I Miss You (Dobie Pt. 2) Come To Me Wanderlust Hyperballad Declare Independence
item.dc:creator: djconnor

Oddly enough, I rarely go to concerts, primarily because I've been disappointed so often and at great cost. However, I make exceptions every once in awhile. On September 24th, we ventured up to Manhattan for Bjork's Madison Square Garden concert.
She was incredible, as was Mark Bell.
This mix is divided into two sections. Act I is if I had any input on the evening's set list. Act II is a close approximation to Bjork's playlist. However, she deviated from album arrangements (as always), so don't expect some black market stream from the show. In any case, please do enjoy.
If you are familiar with Bjork, I hope you rejoice in this mix, as I'm sure Christina, Mariana, and Sean will. If you're not very familiar with her music, take a trip down this musical path, with an open mind and willing ears. I assure you it is all worthwhile.

Act II: The Concert Hunter Pagan Poetry I See Who You Are Unravel Pleasure Is All Mine The Dull Flame Of Desire Joga Desired Constellation Army Of Me Innocence I Miss You (Dobie Pt. 2) Come To Me Wanderlust Hyperballad Declare Independence

item.title: House [ Deep / French ] | Eyes on the Prize
item.description: Everytime I make a house mix, I wonder why it's been so long since the last. Man, I love house music. I'm feeling a deep house groove this time around. Miguel Migs- the French Sessions- Mark Farina's Mushroom Jazz- hell, why not throw in some french house just for balance? (Who can forget St Germain or some Montmartre funk?) As always, comments welcome. Enjoy. [Sampled by] Antonio Carlos Jobim | No More Blues Alistair Colling Vs. Tortured Soul | When You Find Your Instrumental Miguel Migs | Take Me To Paradise (Summer Lover's Dub) Paula Ralph | Ain't No Running Away [Broken Down Instrumental] Superfunk | Lucky Star Kings Of Tomorrow | Let It Go (Remix) Martin Solveig | Heart of Africa Fallen Angel | Toka Project (Stephane Pompougnac Mix) The Realm | One Chance (The Realm House Mix) Crazy Penis | Music's My Love Oscar | Sunday 17th Jazzanova | Soon (ft Vikter Duplaix) Mark Farina & Valerie Etienne | Naked Funk St Germain | Sure thing
item.dc:creator: djconnor
item.itunes:summary:
Everytime I make a house mix, I wonder why it's been so long since the last. Man, I love house music.
I'm feeling a deep house groove this time around. Miguel Migs- the French Sessions- Mark Farina's Mushroom Jazz- hell, why not throw in some french house just for balance? (Who can forget St Germain or some Montmartre funk?)
As always, comments welcome.
Enjoy.
[Sampled by] Antonio Carlos Jobim | No More Blues Alistair Colling Vs. item.title: Jazz | Burnin Cans
item.description: Charles Mingus is known to have once said that, "If Bird was alive today, he would think he was living in a hall of mirrors." In that respect, the ultimate flattery certainly is imitation. And while I may not be able to play the jazz sax like some cats out there, I hope to share some burnin moments from the Greats with you. This joint goes out to all you cats who want to hear something beyond the accepted Miles Davis cut. So do me favor: Dim the lights, sit back, relax, and enjoy some finger zingin good times. Charlie Parker | Parker's Mood Perez Prado | La Borrachita The Caribbean Jazz Project | Minor Mood Lester Young | Jump, Lester, Jump Charles Mingus | Tea for Two Fats Navarro | Fat Girl Ahmad Jamal | Ghetto Child Kruder & Dorfmeister | Definition Tosca | Heidi Bruehl Yusef Lateef | Blues for the Orient
